Anggaran Pemberdayaan Diharapkan Mampu Kembalikan Kejayaan Koperasi
07 Nov 2019, 21:40 by Syarif Hasan Salampessy


Anggaran Pemberdayaan Diharapkan Mampu Kembalikan Kejayaan Koperasi

KBRN, Jakarta: Anggaran pemberdayaan koperasi yang dinilai masih terlalu kecil diharapkan mampu mengembalikan kejayaan koperasi dan mewujudkannya sebagai soko guru perekonomian nasional.
Dalam Rapat Kerja Menteri Koperasi dan UKM bersama Komisi VI DPR RI di Senayan, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11), Menteri Koperasi dan UKM Teten Masduki mengatakan pagu alokasi anggaran Kementerian Koperasi dan UKM untuk 2020 sebesar Rp972,3 miliar.
Dari jumlah itu program penguatan kelembagaan koperasi sebesar 3 persen dan program peningkatan penghidupan berkelanjutan berbasis usaha mikro sebesar 9 persen dari total anggaran.
“Anggaran terbesar dialokasikan untuk program peningkatan daya saing UMKM dan koperasi yang mencapai 56 persen dari seluruh total anggaran,” katanya.
Sementara sisanya digunakan untuk program peningkatan sarana dan prasarana aparatur Kementerian Koperasi dan UKM dan program dukungan manajemen dan pelaksanaan tugas teknis lainnya.
Pada kesempatan itu, Teten Masduki menyampaikan lima program strategis yang akan diimplementasikan ke depan yakni pengembangan dan perluasan akses pasar, peningkatan daya saing dan kapasitas produk dan jasa UMKM, pembiayaan dan investasi yang mudah, pengembangan kapasitas manajemen usaha, serta pengembangan kemudahan iklim usaha dan kesempatan berusaha.
Anggota Komisi VI DPR dari Fraksi Partai Golkar Lamhot Sinaga mengatakan anggaran koperasi yang kecil menjadi cermin dan bentuk tidak ada kepedulian kepada koperasi sementara di satu sisi koperasi diharapkan menjadi soko guru perekonomian nasional.
“Permintaan kami koperasi harus dihidupkan kembali, kembalikan koperasi yang pernah berjaya di masa lalu yang bisa menopang ekonomi rakyat Indonesia secara luas. Apakah dengan pos anggaran yang kecil apa bisa, tapi dengan segala kreativitas Pak Teten kami percaya itu bisa dilakukan,” kata Lamhot.
Sementara anggota Komisi VI DPR RI lainnya yakni Mohamad Idris Laena sempat mempertanyakan lima program strategis yang dicanangkan Menteri Koperasi dan UKM Teten Masduki yang dianggap tidak menyentuh koperasi dan hanya fokus pada UKM.
“Tidak ada program tentang koperasinya, ini perlu mindset harus disamakan dulu. Ada hal yang berbeda ketika bicara tentang koperasi dan UKM. Kita harus bedakan dulu koperasi ya koperasi dan UKM ya UKM,” kata Idris.
Idris mengusulkan agar ke depan dilakukan restrukturisasi manajemen di lingkup Kementerian Koperasi dan UKM.
“Perlu ada deputi yang mengurus soal koperasi, dan khusus deputi yang mengurus UKM karena ini dua hal yang berbeda,” kata Idris.
Sementara anggota Komisi VI DPR RI dari Fraksi PAN Nasril Bahar mempertanyakan eksistensi Lembaga Pengelola Dana Bergulir (LPDB-KUMKM) apakah akan dipertahankan atau tidak ke depan.
“Dalam dua tahun mati suri, menitipkan uang negara kepada perbankan padahal semestinya dana bergulir digulirkan ke koperasi dan UMKM,” kata Nasril.

The Empowerment Budget is expected to be able to restore the glory of cooperatives
Nov 7 2019, 21:40 by Syarif Hasan Salampessy


The Empowerment Budget is expected to be able to restore the glory of cooperatives

KBRN, Jakarta: The cooperative empowerment budget which is considered too small is expected to be able to restore the glory of cooperatives and realize them as the pillars of the national economy.
In the Working Meeting of the Minister of Cooperatives and SMEs with the Commission VI of the Indonesian Parliament in Senayan, Jakarta, Thursday (7/11), the Minister of Cooperatives and SMEs Teten Masduki said the ceiling for the Ministry of Cooperatives and SME budget allocation for 2020 was Rp972.3 billion.
Of that number the cooperative institutional strengthening program was 3 percent and the microenterprise-based sustainable livelihood improvement program was 9 percent of the total budget.
"The biggest budget is allocated for the program to increase the competitiveness of MSMEs and cooperatives which reaches 56 percent of the total budget," he said.
While the rest is used for facilities and infrastructure improvement programs for the Ministry of Cooperatives and SMEs apparatus and management support programs and other technical tasks.
On that occasion, Teten Masduki delivered five strategic programs that will be implemented going forward namely the development and expansion of market access, enhancing the competitiveness and capacity of MSME products and services, easy financing and investment, developing business management capacity, and developing the ease of the business climate and opportunities attempted.
DPR Commission VI member from the Golkar Party faction Lamhot Sinaga said the small cooperative budget is a mirror and forms of no concern for cooperatives while on the one hand cooperatives are expected to become pillars of the national economy.
"Our demand for cooperatives must be revived, returning cooperatives that have triumphed in the past that can sustain the Indonesian economy at large. Is it possible to do a small budget item, but with all the creativity of Mr. Teten we believe it can be done, "said Lamhot.
While another member of the House of Representatives Commission VI Mohamad Idris Laena questioned five strategic programs launched by the Minister of Cooperatives and SMEs Teten Masduki who were considered not to touch cooperatives and only focused on SMEs.
"There is no program about cooperation, this needs to be the mindset that must be compared first. There are different things when talking about cooperatives and SMEs. We have to differentiate between cooperatives, cooperatives and UKM, UKM, "Idris said.
Idris suggested that management restructuring be carried out within the Ministry of Cooperatives and SMEs in the future.
"There needs to be a deputy who takes care of cooperatives, and specifically deputies who take care of SMEs because these are two different things," Idris said.
While member of the DPR RI Commission VI from the PAN Faction Nasril Bahar questioned the existence of the Revolving Fund Management Agency (LPDB-KUMKM) whether or not it would be maintained in the future.
"Within two years of suspended animation, leave the state money to banks when the revolving funds should have been rolled out to cooperatives and MSMEs," Nasril said.
